page.title: 03CROP SPRAYING NEAR ANDOVER
page.content:
Middle Wyke and Lower Wyke are typical of the small farms in this part of Hampshire.
On the day of our visit, a fixed wing aeroplane was sweeping down low over the fields spraying the oil seed rape crop with a chemical which slows down the rate at which the seed pods open.
Spraying from the air by aeroplane or helicopter is very expensive and the farmers use this method only if it is too difficult to spray the crops by tractor. Most of the spraying is done to control harmful insects and fungi.
